actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Committee on Post Office and Civil Service discharged.
Mr. Wynn asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that June 21, 1994, be designated as "Freedom Summer Remembrance Day" and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that: (1) June 21, 1994, is designated as Freedom Summer Remembrance Day; and (2) it reaffirms the goal of removing remaining barriers to full voter participation in this Nation.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that June 21, 1994, be designated as "Freedom Summer Remembrance Day" and for other purposes.
